definition: firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: With perseverance one surmounts all difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 只要坚韧不拔，就能战胜万难。

sentences.english: I like euphrates poplar because they symbolize the resilience of the Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 我非常喜欢胡杨，它是中华民族坚韧不拔精神的象征。

sentences.english: God's love is patient, persistent, and persevering.
sentences.chinese: 上帝的爱充满耐心，持续不断并且坚韧不拔。

sentences.english: Such conviction stems from his keen focus and veracious tenacity.
sentences.chinese: 如此的犯罪手法来源于他的专注以及坚韧不拔。

sentences.english: He liked their toughness and their loyalty .
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢他们的坚韧不拔和忠贞不二。

sentences.english: Watson smiled at the man's unfaltering courage.
sentences.chinese: 华生见他这种坚韧不拔的勇气，不由得展出笑容。

sentences.english: This is the president who is pushing ahead grittily with his economic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 这是一位坚韧不拔地推行经济改革的总统。

sentences.english: As an expression of indomitable spirit of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 以此表达华夏儿女的坚韧不拔的精神。

definition: to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
not to submit to force (idiom); to defy threats and violence
